column4: hi all, any idea on how can i reinstall tzdata? it has a lot of dependencies
perhaps a dpkg reconfigure tzdate command of some sort?
i'll try, thanks
being new here, can you help me with syntax?
i dont know the exact syntax, only that i had to do a dpkg reconfigure xorg-server at some point, this looks like the same thing to em
ok thanks. I'll try to find the reconfigure option
dpkg-reconfigure tzdata
yes! a tricky one :)
thanks. now i have dependency problems
do you know the dselect command?
sudo apt-get install dselect
it can fix and install packages, its interactive
trying, thanks
i can't install anything while tzdata isn't working properly
zomg :(
your tzdata looks severely weird from that link
i'm not sure what to do, but this is a case where your package system needs fixing
dpkg --fix or something i believe, lemme google a bit
try reading http://tinyurl.com/2ave3eq
something like: apt-get -f install tzdata
yay \o/
:) that is actually the first time tzdata did something right for the last week
